1555089595_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
Please stop spreading misinformation.

Most probably this have nothing with any of my repositories, but because of automatic anti-spam filter malfunction or because of spam or other terms of service violation of other user from my ISP network subnet.

I'm not blaming Github, and would like to ask you not to blame it without a reason. All I wrote is a series of tweets which refer to free internet services in general, not to Github, which were misinterpreted by many. I'm pretty sure this is not a censorship act, but a small mistake of anti-spam algorithm.

I get:
>Your account has been flagged.
Because of that, your profile is hidden from the public. If you believe this is a mistake, contact support to have your account status reviewed.

And if I try to log in using Github's OAuth:
>You are marked as spam, and therefore cannot authorize a third party application.

A quick search reveals that I'm not the only one with that problem and it happened to people before, for example:

https://medium.com/swlh/github-banned-us-without-notice-is-microsoft-the-risk-we-didnt-consider-a153f11cb1b1

https://github.community/t5/How-to-use-Git-and-GitHub/why-my-account-has-been-flagged/td-p/16104
